metadata.title: CVE-2021-20261 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the Linux kernels implementation of thefloppy disk drive controller driver software. The impact of this issue islessened by the fact that the default permissions on the floppy device(/dev/fd0) are restricted to root. If the permissions on the device havechanged the impact changes greatly. In the default configuration root (orequivalent) permissions are required to attack this flaw.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.100').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.161').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1154.164').
